verses.verse: He breaks me with wound upon wound; He runs at me like a warrior.
“I have sewn sackcloth over my skin, And (Job 30:19; Ps. 7:5) laid my head in the dust.
My face is flushed from weeping, And on my eyelids is the shadow of death;
Although no violence is in my hands, And my prayer is pure.
“O earth, do not cover my blood, And (Job 27:9; (Ps. 66:18)) let my cry have no resting place!
Surely even now (Gen. 31:50; Rom. 1:9; Phil. 1:8; 1 Thess. 2:5) my witness is in heaven, And my evidence is on high.
My friends scorn me; My eyes pour out tears to God.
(Job 31:35; Eccl. 6:10; (Is. 45:9; Rom. 9:20)) Oh, that one might plead for a man with God, As a man pleads for his neighbor!
For when a few years are finished, I shall (Job 10:21; Eccl. 12:5) go the way of no return.
Job Prays for Relief “My spirit is broken, My days are extinguished, (Ps. 88:3, 4) The grave is ready for me.
Are not mockers with me? And does not my eye dwell on their (1 Sam. 1:6; Job 12:4; 17:6; 30:1, 9; 34:7) provocation?
“Now put down a pledge for me with Yourself. Who is he who (Prov. 6:1; 17:18; 22:26) will shake hands with me?
For You have hidden their heart from (Job 12:20; 32:9) understanding; Therefore You will not exalt them.
He who speaks flattery to his friends, Even the eyes of his children will (Job 11:20) fail.
“But He has made me (Job 30:9) a byword of the people, And I have become one in whose face men spit.
(Ps. 6:7; 31:9) My eye has also grown dim because of sorrow, And all my members are like shadows.
